review_title: Low Pay is still Low Pay
job_title: Work Study Student in West Hartford, CT
pros:
The only benefit if you get a work-study program that does more than give you a paystub. If you go with the generic jobs available like working at the library, you will have little to no networking capabilities.
As mentioned above, if you get the right work-study with the University title, you can get more opportunities to increase your resume like additional programs than just working the generic jobs available. If you work at the library or food/staff area that is all you will get, nothing else.
cons:
The pay is horrendously low. You start out making $10.00 and now, only because of the recent wage increases in CT, its up to $12.00-$13.00 an hour. 
Still low. The school is very exploitative when it comes to low-pay and cut-backs. 
This school treats its work study students as disposable when it comes to pay and benefits. 97% of students are on FASFA and yet the work-study wages still keep them in a below low-income category. 
There are 0 benefits. If you miss a day, you miss a day. It is not covered. And being on the low-wages work-study is that means a good chunk of your pay is already decreased.
The maximum hours to work a week is 10, not 12. 
So far i've had good interactions with my work-study boss, but i'm not sure this is the case for other students.

job_title: Manager in West Hartford, CT
pros:
Excellent mission and community-focus
Dedication to diversity and inclusion
As an employee, you feel like part of something important.
Benefits are good
cons:
Pay is pretty low
When there is employee-management conflict, they are slow to address it if at all.
Some of the processes are mind-bogglingly complex and slow - for example trying to get a vendor paid requires numerous signatures in different departments.

review_title: My experience has been over all positive, with some caveats.
job_title: in West Hartford, CT
pros: The University is small, so there is not much of a chance to grow. In some departments people have been in their position for a long time. In other departments there is high turnover. My job has been satisfactory overall, and I see others taking advantage of the educational opportunities, which is a very big PRO, so there are definitely some good aspects to University life.
cons: On the other hand, the pay is low, and depending on your job, the stress can be high - with little support from management. This isn't the case for myself, but I see it. You also don't find the competence that is generally required in a business environment. Frankly, the standards aren't that high, and with mini-fiefdoms people tend to be resistant to change.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in West Hartford, CT
pros: Great Benefits, Tuition Remission, decent Vacation and Personal Time. I really enjoy working for the University, but some departments are very difficult to work with.
cons: Department Heads are older and do not know how to use technology, low-pay, not as many perks as you would think. Very few Holidays off. The kids who go here are pretentious and will lie to get their way. No formal lock-down procedures other than the dorms. You are expected to work from home and take calls as early at 6:00am and as late as 11:00pm in some departments.

review_title: Great community and extremely helpful staff.
job_title: Tutor With Student Success Center in West Hartford, CT
pros: Great way to reinforce knowledge discussed in core classes.  Tutoring keeps you fresh on many difficult concepts that are not discussed often but are crucial for developing concepts in higher level classes.
cons: The main issues working with the Student Success Center as a tutor was the constant changes in how a tutor has to sign in/clock hours. The clocking system is redundant since it must be completed online and on paper.

review_title: UHa provides a safe, supportive collegial community in which to work.
job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Hartford, CT
pros: My Department Chair and colleagues were very supportive and accessible. They fostered a sense of community by sharing information and ideas regularly. They were professional, ethical, and committed to student progress and development.  Students are generally courteous and responsive. There was a good variety of speakers/cultural events available on campus.
cons: The facilities were not as state of the art as some of the public institutions at which I have worked (which quite frankly surprised me considering the cost of tuition). It may have changed in the last year, but many rooms were not equipped with computer access and computer/overhead projection capabilities. Rooms for occassional student computer use booked quickly and were difficult to schedule. Salary was slightly below that of public institutions for similar work.

job_title: in West Hartford, CT
pros: It was wonderful having the opportunity to take classes for fun or towards a Masters degree during your time as a University of Hartford employee. Great way to earn a degree while working full time.
cons: Unfortunately salary was very weak, and not open to negotiation. There was not enough room for  grow and have the opportunity to increase compensation.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in West Hartford, CT
pros: I work for the Hartt School Community Division. The flexible hours are great. The office staff from top to bottom is really helpful and encouraging. By and large the parents and students I've worked with have been wonderful.
cons: The website is really a mess. I'm sure it effects how many students sign up for lessons. Also, how those students get placed with teachers is pretty unclear to me. I feel like I have a bunch of times that are going unused, but no students to fill them. Meanwhile other teachers have many more students.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Hartford, CT
pros: great environment, lots of intelligent co workers. I always felt like people valued my work and cared about my wellbeing. the surrounding areas are safe and historic.
cons: the weather was not good but it is the north east so it comes with the territory. I was a student worker so I didn't get paid much but it was something.

review_title: Some good benefits, low staff morale
job_title: Marketing Manager in West Hartford, CT
pros: Good 403b and education benefits. New president has big plans, which could seriously improve the University if they are achieved. Great student body, despite the very public and awful actions of a very small few.
cons: Poor health insurance benefits.  Poor staff morale. Bleak outlook. Little room for movement. Difficulty getting its employees on par with regional pay rates.

job_title: in West Hartford, CT
pros: The benefits package is first rate.  There are pockets of excellence in curriculum and programming. There is a general desire to improve services.
cons: The institution is severly under-staffed and under-resourced.  Low salaries encourage a very low retention rate among mid to upper level managers.  Progress is made only through dogged and non-compensated persistence.

job_title: in West Hartford, CT
pros: The Hartford area is quite nice to live in and generally most departments are laid back. If you don't get too deep into academic matters (I was not) then you will find it to be an enjoyable workplace.
cons: Nobody can communicate with each other. There is very little knowledge and information shared and much discussion goes on behind closed doors.

job_title: Appointed Account Executive in Hartford, CT
pros: You get a single room which are a commodity. They also give you the most expensive meal plan. depending on your RD you can learn important leadership and team work skills
cons: Depending on where you get placed you have have to share an apartment with other people. They are not open to suggestion. They will hear you out but change and understanding does not come easy

job_title: Telecommunications in West Hartford, CT
pros: I worked with them for a short time and was always supported by the entire department. Some mid level management tried to ensured that professional needs were mostly met. Great working environment.
cons: Salary was very little to start for the amount of responsibility, tasks and skills required for the job. Should consider salary review to attract more qualified applicants.

job_title: in Windsor, CT
pros: Good staff and friendly. Beautiful campus. Depending on department you have flexibility to leave office to take advantage of offerings. Interacting with students has its pros and cons
cons: Some departments are better than others. Supervisors need more training. Too many get power hungry. Also staff are not treated with the same respect as facult
